page.title: 15AMENITIES
page.content: The village of Marston has a post office, a shop, a mobile library, bank, butcher and baker. It also has a public house and a school. The village streets are cleaned by the council road sweeper and rubbish collected weekly. There are daily deliveries of milk and weekly deliveries of coal. Mail of course is delivered six days per week. Newspapers are delivered daily, morning and evening. The village has a hairdresser working from home. The village hall is used twice a week as a doctor's surgery and welfare clinic for babies. The village hall also has a playing field with play area for children as well as a football pitch and cricket pitch.
